Question

# Aufgabe


Erstellen Sie eine Analyse, die einem typischen Vorhersageprojekt entspricht!

Nutzen Sie den Datensatz `penguins`!

Sagen Sie die Variable `body_mass_g` vorher.

Hinweise:

- Halten Sie die Analyse einfach.
- Teilen Sie Test- vs. Train-Set hälftig auf.
- Teilen Sie Analysis vs. Assessment-Set 3:1 auf.
- Den Datensatz `penguins` können Sie entweder aus dem Paket `palmerpenguins` beziehen oder z.B. von [hier](https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/palmerpenguins/penguins.csv) via `read_csv()` importieren.


</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>

# Lösung


Pakete laden:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidymodels)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```

```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```

```

```

```


:::

library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ readr     2.1.4

```

✖ purrr::discard()    masks scales::discard()

ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(easystats)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
# Attaching packages: easystats 0.6.0 (red = needs update)
✔ bayestestR  0.13.1   ✔ correlation 0.8.4 
✔ datawizard  0.9.0    ✔ effectsize  0.8.6 
✔ insight     0.19.6   ✔ modelbased  0.8.6 
✔ performance 0.10.8   ✔ parameters  0.21.3
✔ report      0.5.7    ✖ see         0.8.0 

Restart the R-Session and update packages in red with `easystats::easystats_update()`.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
data("penguins", package = "palmerpenguins")
```
:::




Man erinnere sich, dass ein R-Paket erst (einmalig) installiert sein muss,
bevor Sie darauf zugreifen können, etwa um Daten - wie den Datensatz `penguins` - 
daraus zu beziehen.



Zeilen mischen und Train- vs. Testset aufteilen:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
penguins2 <-
  penguins %>% 
  sample_n(size = nrow(.))

d_train <- penguins2 %>% slice(1:(344/2))
d_test <- penguins2 %>% slice(173:nrow(penguins))
```
:::




Das Trainset weiter aufteilen:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_split <- initial_split(d_train)

d_analysis <- training(d_split)
d_assessment <- testing(d_split)
```
:::



Rezept definieren:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
rec1 <-
  recipe(body_mass_g ~ ., data = d_analysis) %>% 
  step_impute_knn(all_predictors()) %>% 
  step_normalize(all_numeric(), -all_outcomes())
```
:::



Rezept prüfen:



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_analysis_baked <- 
rec1 %>% 
  prep() %>% 
  bake(new_data = NULL)

describe_distribution(d_analysis_baked)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Variable          |      Mean |     SD |     IQR |              Range | Skewness | Kurtosis |   n | n_Missing
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
bill_length_mm    | -5.24e-16 |   1.00 |    1.75 |      [-1.97, 1.84] |    -0.07 |    -1.20 | 129 |         0
bill_depth_mm     |  5.78e-16 |   1.00 |    1.72 |      [-1.84, 2.13] |    -0.10 |    -0.97 | 129 |         0
flipper_length_mm | -9.79e-16 |   1.00 |    1.67 |      [-2.04, 2.08] |     0.25 |    -0.99 | 129 |         0
year              | -2.16e-15 |   1.00 |    2.43 |      [-1.20, 1.22] |     0.01 |    -1.53 | 129 |         0
body_mass_g       |   4152.71 | 735.49 | 1212.50 | [2850.00, 5800.00] |     0.21 |    -0.88 | 129 |         0
```


:::
:::




Workflow und CV definieren:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
m1 <- 
  linear_reg()

wf1 <-
  workflow() %>% 
  add_recipe(rec1) %>% 
  add_model(m1)

cv_scheme <- vfold_cv(d_analysis, v = 2)
```
:::




Fitten (hier kein Tuning):


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit1 <-
  wf1 %>% 
  tune_grid(resamples = cv_scheme)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: No tuning parameters have been detected, performance will be evaluated
using the resamples with no tuning. Did you want to [tune()] parameters?
```


:::
:::



Finalisieren:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
show_best(fit1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: No value of `metric` was given; metric 'rmse' will be used.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 6
  .metric .estimator  mean     n std_err .config             
  <chr>   <chr>      <dbl> <int>   <dbl> <chr>               
1 rmse    standard    314.     2    19.7 Preprocessor1_Model1
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
wf1_final <-
  wf1 %>% 
  finalize_workflow(show_best(fit1))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: No value of `metric` was given; metric 'rmse' will be used.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
wf1_final
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
══ Workflow ════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Preprocessor: Recipe
Model: linear_reg()

── Preprocessor ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2 Recipe Steps

• step_impute_knn()
• step_normalize()

── Model ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Linear Regression Model Specification (regression)

Computational engine: lm 
```


:::
:::



Modellgüte:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fit1_final <-
  wf1_final %>% 
  last_fit(d_split)


collect_metrics(fit1_final)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 4
  .metric .estimator .estimate .config             
  <chr>   <chr>          <dbl> <chr>               
1 rmse    standard     296.    Preprocessor1_Model1
2 rsq     standard       0.911 Preprocessor1_Model1
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
fit1_train <-
  wf1_final %>% 
  fit(d_train)


fit1_test <-
  fit1_train %>% 
  predict(d_test)

head(fit1_test)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 6 × 1
  .pred
  <dbl>
1 3557.
2 3969.
3 4073.
4 5497.
5 3341.
6 4671.
```


:::
:::





Vgl <https://workflows.tidymodels.org/reference/predict-workflow.html>


Submitten:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
subm_df <-
  d_test %>% 
  mutate(id = 173:344) %>% 
  bind_cols(fit1_test) %>% 
  select(id, .pred) %>% 
  rename(pred = .pred)
```
:::




Und als CSV-Datei speichern:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#write_csv(subm_df, file = "submission_blabla.csv")
```
:::
